title: New Holland LX865 Skid Steer: How to Flush Water-Contaminated Hydraulic Oil & Prevent Future Issues.

tasks.task: The task involves fixing a water contamination issue in a New Holland hydraulic system.
subtasks: Remove the dipstick to check the contaminated hydraulic fluid (white and milky).
Use a pump to drain the reservoir and siphon contaminated oil into a bucket.
Inspect and replace damaged gaskets and seals around the reservoir cap to prevent future water ingress.
Apply silicone sealant to the existing gasket to reinforce the seal around the reservoir.
Cover the reservoir cap with a plastic container to prevent water entry.
Check and possibly replace the hydraulic filter.
Drain and flush auxiliary hydraulic lines by bleeding each line and collecting output in a bucket.
Refill the reservoir with clean hydraulic fluid after draining.
Operate the machine briefly to circulate the new fluid through the lines.
Re-bleed the hydraulic system to ensure all air is expelled and fluid is properly distributed.
Remove the old filter and install a new one.

tasks.task: Apply silicone sealant to other potential water entry points.
subtasks: Seal around the dipstick and any other openings prone to water ingress.
